header.description: This CyberArk plugin enables credentials/secrets to be retrieved from a CyberArk Vault or Conjur.

step-type.name: Get Password from CCP (Web Service)
step-type.description: Retrieve a password from CyberArk AIM Central Credential Provider via an HTTP request. The Central Credential Provider is installed remote to the agent on a central IIS server. This step will set the CyberArk/username, CyberArk/address, and CyberArk/password properties at either the component process request level or the generic process request level.

property-ui.label: Server URL
property-ui.description: The URL of your CyberArk server. This property should be specified in the format 'https://<host:port>/AIMWebService/api/accounts'.

property-ui.label: Application ID
property-ui.description: The unique ID of the application issuing the password request.

property-ui.label: Safe
property-ui.description: The name of the safe where the password is stored.

property-ui.label: Folder
property-ui.description: The name of the folder where the password is stored.

property-ui.label: Object Name
property-ui.description: The name of the password object to retrieve.

property-ui.label: Keystore File
property-ui.description: The path to the agent machine's keystore file. This is required when the CyberArk server authenticates applications using client certificates.

property-ui.label: Keystore Password
property-ui.description: The password of the agent machine's keystore.

property-ui.label: Keystore Type
property-ui.description: The type of keystore on the agent machine.

property-ui.label: Trust Invalid Certificates
property-ui.description: Check this box to trust all SSL certificates on the agent machine. This will trust any certificate returned from the CyberArk server during connection.

property-ui.label: Process Request ID
property-ui.description: Property to reference the ID of the process request. This will either be a component process request or a generic process request.

property-ui.label: Process ID
property-ui.description: The ID of the generic process. If the requested process derives from a component process this property will be empty.

step-type.name: Get Password from CP (CLI Utility)
step-type.description: Retrieve a password from CyberArk AIM Credential Provider via the clipasswordsdk command line utillity on the agent machine. This step will set the CyberArk/username, CyberArk/address, and CyberArk/password properties at either the component process request level or the generic process request level.

property-ui.label: Path
property-ui.description: Full path to clipasswordsdk. E.g. /opt/CARKaim/sdk/clipasswordsdk

property-ui.label: Safe
property-ui.description: Safe name

property-ui.label: Folder
property-ui.description: Folder name

property-ui.label: Object
property-ui.description: Object name of the credential

property-ui.label: AppID
property-ui.description: AppID configured in CyberArk PVWA

property-ui.label: Ouput Property - Password
property-ui.description: Process Request Property for storing the retrieved password

property-ui.label: Ouput Property - User Name
property-ui.description: Process Request Property for storing the retrieved user name

property-ui.label: Ouput Property - Address
property-ui.description: Process Request Property for storing the retrieved address

property-ui.label: Process Request ID
property-ui.description: Property to reference the ID of the process request. This will either be a component process request or a generic process request.

property-ui.label: Process ID
property-ui.description: The ID of the generic process. If the requested process derived from a component process this property will be empty.
